thread.title: New West terror group mocked as the' Ooh R A' over Devon border | Devon Live

author: Jeff Reines
title: New West terror group mocked as the' Ooh R A' over Devon border | Devon Live
text:
New West terror group mocked as the' Ooh R A' over Devon border By WMN_PGoodwin | Posted: July 09, 2017 By Jeff Reines 0 COMMENTS SHARES The Cornish independence group drew parallels with the freedom fighters in Monty Python's Life of Brian New West terror group mocked as the' Ooh R A' over Devon border X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
The news that a Cornish nationalist group has claimed responsibility for a fire at a Rick Stein restaurant and has a female member willing to "pay the ultimate price in the battle" for independence has been ridiculed in the most hilarious way. 
The self-styled Cornish Republican Army (CRA) said it had to change its name from the Cornish Nationalist Liberation Army because its name had been used by others. 
The reboot has been compared to Monty Python's film The Life of Brian in which the 'Judean People's Front' feuded with its rival 'People's Front of Judea'. 
All the reaction has been compiled by our sister site across the Tamar, Cornwall Live. 
READ MORE: Independence terror group across Devon border says it has female suicide bomber 
In the statement the group, which also claimed to have set off a "practice device", adds that the decision was taken to make fundraising easier in the USA and in the other Celtic Nations. 
Locals mocked the move to create a Cornish IRA (Irish Republican Army), making reference to the 'Oooh Arrr Ey'. 
References were also made to comedian Jack Whitehall's The Bad Education Movie, which revolved around a school trip to Cornwall and included a Cornish Republican Army line. 
Read more: 12 new things we discovered on our tour of the new look Chevalier In n in Exeter 
A section of the statement reads: "Our organisation has grown and we now have one member who is prepared to pay the ultimate price in the battle for Kernow. She is prepared to sacrifice herself although we shall not ask for this lightly - only as a last measure. 
"We did set off a practice device in the old Redruth Brewery and are responsible for the two fires in Truro and the one in Penryn. 
"We have also issued warnings to owners of holiday businesses flying the blood cross flag." 
It also said it will continue its action against second homes owned by "the English". 
The CRA also posted an announcement on the blog says that it is pleased to announce substantial funding from the other Celtic Countries and from Irish groups in the United States of America. 
Read more: Campaigners say Brexit will mean more dead dolphins will be found on Devon's beaches 
It also claims to have welcomed members from the Free Wales Army ( FWA ), the Scottish National Liberation Army ( SNLA ) and members of the Irish National Liberation Army ( INLA ) and the now defunct Provisional Irish Republican Army (Provisional IRA). 
The Cornish Republic Army says it has limited weapons available but intends to rely on more controlled methods to achieve its aims. 
While it appears to want to be taken very seriously, comments on the Cornwall Live Facebook page would indicate that the reaction has been far from it. 
This story first appeared on Cornwall Live which has decided not to publish a direct link to the blog involved.
